The municipality calls itself "Ōta City" in English.Ōta City; retrieved 2012-4-2. ==History== Ōta Dōkan was the founder of Edo (now known as Tokyo).Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Ōta Dōkan" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 762. On 15 March 1947, the ward of Ōta was formed by combining the wards of Kamata and Ōmori. ==Geography== Ōta is a southern ward of Tokyo. Its southern border is the Tama River and the city of Kawasaki in Kanagawa Prefecture. On the north, Ōta borders the special wards of Shinagawa, Meguro and Setagaya.
